After White plays Nd7, Black has a strong tactical rejoinder that regains the lost material with a favorable structure.  The knight on d7 is simultaneously attacked by three black pieces (Qd8, Bc8 and Nf6), while White has only the queen as direct defender.  

Crucially, **1…B:d7** hits the knight with the bishop **before White can reinforce**, and after the natural 2 Q:d7 comes **2… N:d7**, recovering the piece cleanly.  White will end up with doubled, isolated d-pawns while Black completes development smoothly.
